title: Advanced Usage of rcpptimer
text: stop() method returns aggregated data DataFrame. However, can also access raw data need . timer class stores timings two vectors: durations tags, public class members. snippet demonstrates access : can see tags vector contains names timings, durations vector contains actual timings (nanoseconds).
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' DataFrame demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   double x=0;   for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++)   {     timer.tic("rnorm");     x += rnorm(1, 1)[0];     timer.toc("rnorm");   }   DataFrame times = DataFrame::create(           Named("Durations") = timer.durations,           Named("Tags") = timer.tags);   return(times); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ##   Durations  Tags ## 1     12945 rnorm ## 2       331 rnorm ## 3       761 rnorm ## 4       151 rnorm ## 5       140 rnorm ## 6       141 rnorm ## 7       280 rnorm

title: Advanced Usage of rcpptimer
text: Sometimes, may want access results Timer instance timers finished. possible. Due way Timer class processes data, also efficient. .aggregate() method (called .stop()) update results new timings observed. snippet demonstrates : use function rcpptimer testing purposes: can see timer “t2” updated new timing. example also shows unnecessary stop timers calling .stop(). example, timer “t1” started calculating results first time, stopped calling .stop() second time. Also, note need manually call .print_warnings() want print warnings early. Otherwise, printed upon destruction Timer instance (e.g., Timer object goes scope).
code: List test_update() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.autoreturn = false;   List L = List::create();   {     Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "t1");     timer.tic("t2");     std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::nanoseconds(5));     timer.toc("t2");     DataFrame results1 = timer.stop();     timer.print_warnings();     L.push_back(results1);     timer.tic("t2");     std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::nanoseconds(500));     timer.toc("t2");     timer.tic("t3");     std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::nanoseconds(500));     timer.toc("t3");   }   DataFrame results2 = timer.stop();   L.push_back(results2);   return (L); } rcpptimer:::test_update() ## Warning in rcpptimer:::test_update(): Timer "t1" not stopped yet.  ## Use toc("t1") to stop the timer. ## [[1]] ##    Microseconds SD    Min    Max Count ## t2       66.635  0 66.635 66.635     1 ##  ## [[2]] ##    Microseconds    SD      Min      Max Count ## t1     1157.487 0.000 1157.487 1157.487     1 ## t2       67.546 1.289   66.635   68.458     2 ## t3       60.975 0.000   60.975   60.975     1

title: Advanced Usage of rcpptimer
text: can reset timer time calling reset() method. method clear instance Timer class reset internal state. example demonstrates use : use function rcpptimer testing purposes:
code: List test_reset() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   {     Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "t1");     timer.autoreturn = false;     timer.tic("t2");     std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::nanoseconds(5));     timer.toc("t2");   }   DataFrame results1 = timer.stop();   timer.reset();   timer.tic("t3");   List L = List::create();   L.push_back(results1);   timer.toc("t3");   DataFrame results2 = timer.stop();   L.push_back(results2);   return (L); } rcpptimer:::test_reset() ## [[1]] ##    Microseconds SD    Min    Max Count ## t1       73.117  0 73.117 73.117     1 ## t2       70.782  0 70.782 70.782     1 ##  ## [[2]] ##    Microseconds SD  Min  Max Count ## t3         5.76  0 5.76 5.76     1

what: Assign a Custom Name to the Timings Object
title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: want give dataframe different name, can pass name constructor:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm() {  Rcpp::Timer timer("mytimes");  timer.tic();  double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];  timer.toc();  return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ## [1] -0.4000435 print(mytimes) ##        Microseconds SD    Min    Max Count ## tictoc       11.422  0 11.422 11.422     1

title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: may need handle resulting DataFrame instead letting rcpptimer write global environment. issue consists two elements: Turn autoreturn feature Handle results First, turn autoreturn, set autoreturn variable Timer instance false. prevent timer writing results global environment. Now, mem write global environment. However, can still access results timer’s .stop() method: also possible use .stop() let rcpptimer pass results automatically. example, just set autoreturn true (default) delete line. can find instructions vignette("advanced") want access raw timings data.
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm() {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  timer.autoreturn = false;  timer.tic("rnorm");  double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];  timer.toc("rnorm");  return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ## [1] 1.255317 print(ls()) ## [1] "demo_rnorm" Rcpp::cppFunction(' DataFrame demo_rnorm() {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  timer.autoreturn = false;  timer.tic("rnorm");  double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];  timer.toc("rnorm");  DataFrame times = timer.stop();  return(times); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() ##       Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count ## rnorm        6.702  0 6.702 6.702     1

title: Automatic and Manual Return of the Timings
text: package author, parameterize auto-return feature users can decide whether want results passed global environment name assigned. example .
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double demo_rnorm(bool return_timings = false,  const char* timings_name = "times") {  Rcpp::Timer timer(timings_name);  timer.autoreturn = return_timings;  timer.tic("rnorm");  double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];  timer.toc("rnorm");  return(x); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm(return_timings = FALSE) ## [1] 0.9944287 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" demo_rnorm(return_timings = TRUE) ## [1] 1.621553 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" "times" demo_rnorm(return_timings = TRUE, timings_name = "my_times") ## [1] 2.148412 ls() ## [1] "demo_rnorm" "my_times"   "times"

title: Adding rcpptimer to a Package
text: Using rcpptimer package simple. Just link DESCRIPTION file: add header .cpp file #include <rcpptimer.h>. Now, can create use instance Rcpp::Timer class. Consider fibonacci_omp function: function available rcpptimer can try , e.g., rcpptimer::fibonacci(n = rep(20:25, 10)). , can inspect timings executing print(times). can see, writes timings global environment data.frame called times. Read following section learn differs want package.
code: LinkingTo: rcpptimer (>= 1.2.0) #include <rcpptimer.h>  long int fib(long int n) {   return ((n <= 1) ? n : fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); }  //[[Rcpp::export]] std::vector<long int> fibonacci_omp(std::vector<long int> n) {   Rcpp::Timer timer;  // This scoped timer measures the total execution time of 'fibonacci'   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scpdtmr(timer, "fib_body");   std::vector<long int> results = n;   #pragma omp parallel for   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n.size(); ++i)   {     timer.tic("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));     results[i] = fib(n[i]);     timer.toc("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));   }   return (results); }

title: Adding rcpptimer to a Package
text: using rcpptimer package, consider turning timer’s autoreturn feature. Users package may need made aware functionality. may already object named times global environment may rigorous expectations objects want write environment. Instead, include timings data structures parameterize name returned object, autoreturn feature , . See vignette("autoreturn") vignette read detail.

title: Adding rcpptimer to a Package
text: use rcpptimer package, may want suggest rcpptimer DESCRIPTION register S3 method print.rcpptimer. method used print timings readable way. scale results readable. .e. timings greater 1 second, print results seconds. Two adjustments necessary package: First, add following line DESCRIPTION file: Second, add following code package: register print.rcpptimer rcpptimer available. can place code function uses rcpptimer package’s .onLoad function1.
code: Suggests: rcpptimer (>= 1.2.0) if (requireNamespace("rcpptimer", quietly = TRUE)) {   registerS3method("print", "rcpptimer", rcpptimer:::print.rcpptimer) }

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: Initializing timer simple. four constructors available. default constructor initializes timer warnings enabled write results data.frame called “times” R environment: throughout vignettes, use four needed.
code: Rcpp::Timer timer; // default constructor Rcpp::Timer timer("my_timer"); // Set a custom name for the results Rcpp::Timer timer(false); // Disable warnings Rcpp::Timer timer("my_timer", false); // Set a custom name and disable warnings

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: Rcpp::cppFunction, must add depends argument function tell compiler want link ‘rcpptimer’ library C++ code. , can construct instance Timer class use tic toc methods measure time takes execute code block. , allocate memory something measure: function automatically write data frame called “times” R environment. Read autoreturn feature (.e., assign custom variable name manually handle results) vignette("autoreturn"). resulting times object two classes: data.frame rcpptimer. provide custom S3 method printing results. registered, may scale results improve readability (see rcpptimer::print.rcpptimer). Otherwise, print results using base::print.data.frame.
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(" double add(double &x, double &y) {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  timer.tic();  double z = x + y;  timer.toc();  return(z); }",   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -0.7992826 print(times) #>        Nanoseconds SD Min Max Count #> tictoc         832  0 832 832     1

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: can also use multiple timers function. Timers can nested overlapping. Just pass string tic toc methods distinguish timers: rcpptimer group multiple timers name calculate summary statistics . Consider advanced example, also uses OpenMP: function included rcpptimer, can execute right away:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  timer.tic("body");  timer.tic("add_1");  timer.tic("add_2");  double z = x + y;  timer.toc("add_1");  timer.toc("add_2");  timer.toc("body");  return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -0.5396038  print(times) #>       Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count #> add_1        0.982  0 0.982 0.982     1 #> add_2        0.872  0 0.872 0.872     1 #> body         3.026  0 3.026 3.026     1 // fibonacci.cpp std::vector<long int> fibonacci_omp(std::vector<long int> n) {    Rcpp::Timer timer;    // This scoped timer measures the total execution time of 'fibonacci'   Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scpdtmr(timer, "fib_body");    std::vector<long int> results = n;  #pragma omp parallel for   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n.size(); ++i)   {     timer.tic("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));     results[i] = fib(n[i]);     timer.toc("fib_" + std::to_string(n[i]));   }    return (results); } results <- rcpptimer::fibonacci_omp(n = rep(20:25, 10)) print(times) #>          Microseconds     SD      Min      Max Count #> fib_20         36.517 18.288   26.890   84.969    10 #> fib_21         43.361 10.357   35.707   65.603    10 #> fib_22         75.097 12.453   69.159  107.171    10 #> fib_23        109.189 22.389   92.934  153.107    10 #> fib_24        187.411 16.543  172.814  215.693    10 #> fib_25        253.670 25.166  237.916  301.794    10 #> fib_body     2365.868  0.000 2365.868 2365.868     1

title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: ScopedTimer lets measure execution time scopes. call ..tic() upon creation .toc() upon destruction. Consider simple example : Note need initialize ScopedTimer. goes scope, timer automatically stopped.
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");  double z = x + y;  return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] 0.7273107  print(times) #>     Nanoseconds SD Min Max Count #> add         842  0 842 842     1

what: Warnings and how to Disable them
title: A Short Introduction to rcpptimer
text: default setting warn timers started using .tic never stopped using .toc() vice versa. useful catch unmatched .tic() .toc() calls may unmatched due missing statements typos. example, following code produce two warnings: Note affect terminated timers ‘mem’. warnings occur runtime. Unfortunately, can’t check compile time. However, can turn warnings passing false constructor. useful need .toc() calls code blocks may get executed, e.g. conditional statements. example produce warnings:
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {  Rcpp::Timer timer;  Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");  timer.tic("add");  double z = x + y;  timer.toc("ad");  return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> Warning in add(rnorm(1), runif(1)): Timer "ad" not started yet.  #> Use tic("ad") to start the timer. #> [1] 0.9221172 print(times) #>     Nanoseconds SD Min Max Count #> add         741  0 741 741     1 Rcpp::cppFunction(' double add(double &x, double &y) {  Rcpp::Timer timer(false);  Rcpp::Timer::ScopedTimer scoped_timer(timer, "add");  timer.tic("add");  double z = x + y;  timer.toc("ad");  return(z); }',   depends = "rcpptimer" )  add(rnorm(1), runif(1)) #> [1] -1.419489  print(times) #>     Nanoseconds SD Min Max Count #> add         651  0 651 651     1

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jonathan Berrisch. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Berrisch J (2024). rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer 'OpenMP' Support. R package version 1.2.1, https://github.com/BerriJ/rcpptimer, https://rcpptimer.berrisch.biz.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer with 'OpenMP' Support},   author = {Jonathan Berrisch},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.1, https://github.com/BerriJ/rcpptimer},   url = {https://rcpptimer.berrisch.biz}, }

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: R Package provides Rcpp bindings cpptimer, simple tic-toc class timing C++ code. ’s just simple, ’s blazing fast! sleek tic-toc timer class supports nested overlapping timers OpenMP parallelism. boasts nanosecond-level time resolution. Results (summary statistics) automatically passed back R data.frame.

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: Install rcpptimer CRAN.
code: install.packages("rcpptimer")

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: straightforward example using Rcpp::Timer Rcpp::cppFunction: timer object automatically write result R environment: Check Documentation : Setting multiple, nested, overlapping timers Using OpenMP parallelism Using rcpptimer Rcpp::sourceCpp Adding rcpptimer package
code: Rcpp::cppFunction(" double demo_rnorm() {   Rcpp::Timer timer;   timer.tic();   double x = rnorm(1, 1)[0];   timer.toc();   return(x); }",   depends = "rcpptimer" )  demo_rnorm() print(times)        Microseconds SD   Min   Max Count tictoc        3.972  0 3.972 3.972     1

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: Processes taking less nanosecond timed. Unmatched .tic() .toc() calls raise errors compile time. However, throw warnings runtime.

title: Rcpp Tic-Toc Timer with OpenMP Support
text: package (underlying cpptimer class) inspired zdebruine’s RcppClock. used package lot wanted add OpenMP support, alter process calculating summary statistics, apply series adjustments. hope find useful.

title: Simple rcpptimer example — fibonacci
text: vector integers giving Fibonacci sum element n

title: Simple rcpptimer example — fibonacci
text: function timed following: int fib(int n) { return ((n <= 1) ? n : fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); } Runtime computations less n = 15 nearly unmeasurable.

what: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
text: Prints times object scales timings appropriate. timings smaller 1 microsecond, timings printed nanoseconds. smallest timing higher Millisecond / Seconds / Minutes / Hours, timings printed unit threshold. behavior can disabled setting scale = FALSE.

title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
code: # S3 method for class 'rcpptimer' print(x, scale = TRUE, ...)

title: Print method for rcpptimer output — print.rcpptimer
text: x Object class rcpptimer scale Scale timings statistics human readable format ... arguments ignored

what: rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer with 'OpenMP' Support — rcpptimer-package

title: rcpptimer: 'Rcpp' Tic-Toc Timer with 'OpenMP' Support — rcpptimer-package
text: Maintainer: Jonathan Berrisch Jonathan@Berrisch.biz (ORCID)

title: rcpptimer 1.2.1
text: release fixes bug calling .toc() timer already stopped cause signed integer overflow. minor change CppTimer well Rcpp::Timer.

title: rcpptimer 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-09-20

title: rcpptimer 1.2.0
text: stop() method Rcpp::Timer now returns data.frame results. useful want set auto return false manually handle results. also possible call aggregate() access public variable data Rcpp::Timer. data map containing results (Names, Mean, Standard Deviation, Count). Look implementation stop() “inst/rcpptimer.h” see works. tag arguments tic(), toc() ScopedTimer() default values now. existing vignette updated, added four new vignettes package. rcpptimer now measures nanoseconds instead microseconds. Adds print.rcpptimer method print results timer object. Timings scaled readable unit (e.g. milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours) appropriate. Warn timers .toc() called . summary now includes minimum maximum times.

title: rcpptimer 1.2.0
text: Added lots tests cover 100% code. Public member “name” moved CppTimer Timer R-specific. Add hex sticker package. package now documentation entry (?rcpptimer). Various improvements underlying CppTimer class

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-20

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: Add new Rcpp::CppTimer::ScopedTimer class. can used time lifespan object goes scope. useful timing duration function loop. fibonacci example updated use new class. Warn timers stopped aggregate called (matching toc() statement). Warn timers matching tic() statement found. Add verbose parameter Timer class control whether warnings printed (defaults true). Add introductory vignette package.

title: rcpptimer 1.1.0
text: led segfault previous version. Fix reset() method working properly cases timers spread multiple methods. Fix non-default constructors Timer class. working properly previous version.

title: rcpptimer 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-05 initial release rcpptimer. based RcppClock contains number improvements: OpenMP support Automatically returns results R soon C++ Object goes scope Fast computation Mean Standard Deviation results C++ Uses tic toc instead tick tock consistent R’s tictoc package Always reports microseconds resolution Many performance improvements
